info.title: YourCar Motor API Proxy
info.description:
Authenticated proxy service for Motor.com automotive repair data.

## Overview
This API provides access to comprehensive automotive repair information including:
- Vehicle identification (VIN decode, Year/Make/Model)
- Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs)
- Technical Service Bulletins (TSBs)
- Wiring Diagrams
- Component Locations
- Repair Procedures
- Parts with OEM pricing
- Specifications & Fluids
- Maintenance Schedules

## Authentication
**No authentication required from clients.** The proxy handles all authentication 
automatically using server-side cookie-based auth to Motor.com.

## Base URL
Production: `https://autolib.web.app/api/motor-proxy`

## Response Format
Most endpoints return responses in this structure:
```json
{
  "header": {
    "status": "OK",
    "statusCode": 200,
    "date": "Sat, 29 Nov 2025 12:00:00 GMT"
  },
  "body": { /* actual data */ }
}
```

get.description: Check proxy status and authentication session
Debug endpoint to get EBSCO connector URL and signature

Returns the current authentication credentials (for debugging).
Shows the token information extracted from the Motor.com session.

Decode a Vehicle Identification Number to get vehicle details.
Returns the vehicleId and contentSource needed for all other API calls.

messages.longDescription: No vehicle found for the provided VIN

get.description: Alias for VIN decode endpoint
Returns all available vehicle model years
Returns all vehicle makes available for a specific year
Returns all models with engine options for a specific year and make
Returns the display name for a vehicle
Returns engine and submodel information

Search for articles matching a vehicle and optional search term.
Returns all content types including procedures, diagrams, specs, DTCs, TSBs.

**Bucket Types:**
- `Diagnostic Trouble Codes` - DTCs
- `Technical Service Bulletins` - TSBs
- `Wiring Diagrams` - Electrical diagrams
- `Component Location Diagrams` - Part locations
- `Specifications` - Torque specs, capacities
- `Interior Panel Replacement Procedures` - Procedures
- `Starter & Alternator Replacement Procedures` - Procedures

parameters.name: motorVehicleId
parameters.description: Motor vehicle ID for engine-specific filtering

get.description: Returns a summary of all content categories and counts
Returns all DTCs available for the vehicle

dtcs.description: Driver Frontal Stage 1 Deployment Control: Circuit Short to Ground
Driver Frontal Stage 1 Deployment Control: Circuit Short to Battery

get.description:
Returns detailed diagnostic information for a specific DTC including:
- Fault conditions
- Possible causes
- Diagnostic procedures
- Related components

text/html.example:
B0001:11 - Driver Frontal Stage 1 Deployment Control

Fault Condition

Circuit Short to Ground detected in the driver airbag deployment circuit.

Possible Causes

  • Damaged wiring harness
  • Faulty clock spring
  • Defective airbag module

get.description: Returns all TSBs for the vehicle

tsbs.title: WATER FOUND IN TRUNK AFTER HEAVY RAIN OR CAR WASH
SUNVISOR(S) DO NOT STAY IN FULLY RETRACTED POSITION

get.description:
Returns full Technical Service Bulletin content including:
- Problem description
- Affected vehicles
- Repair procedure
- Parts required
- Labor allowance

text/html.example:
TSB 09-034/25

WATER FOUND IN TRUNK AFTER HEAVY RAIN OR CAR WASH

Released: August 20, 2025

Affected Vehicles

2019-2021 Mazda 3 (All models)

Problem Description

Customer may report water accumulation in the trunk area...

Repair Procedure

  1. Inspect trunk lid weatherstrip...
  2. Replace weatherstrip if damaged...

body.note: Labor times are associated with individual procedures. Use /labor/{articleId} to get labor time for a specific article.

get.description:
Returns the full HTML content of an article including:
- Step-by-step procedures
- Diagrams and images (as embedded references)
- Specifications and torque values
- Notes and cautions

parameters.name: motorVehicleId
parameters.description: Motor vehicle ID for engine-specific content

text/html.example:
Alternator R&R

Removal

  1. Disconnect the negative battery cable.
  2. Remove the drive belt. See Drive Belt R&R.
  3. Disconnect the alternator electrical connectors.

Torque Specifications

Alternator mounting bolts18 Nm (13 ft-lbs)

post.description: Saves a bookmark for an article

get.description: Retrieves a saved bookmark by ID
Returns an asset (image/document) by its handle ID (GUID)

post.description: Returns detailed information for multiple vehicles by their IDs

get.description: Alternative endpoint for getting models, returns Motor-specific format

Prior route for retrieving images. Deprecated but kept for backwards compatibility
with saved bookmarks. Use `/api/source/{contentSource}/graphic/{id}` instead.
Returns just the title of an article (faster than full content)

example.body: Alternator R&R - With Variable Engine Displacement

get.description:
Returns the raw XML content of an article. 
Useful for parsing structured data programmatically.

application/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<article id="P:538499065">
  <title>Alternator R&R</title>
  <procedure>
    <step number="1">Disconnect the negative battery cable.</step>
    <step number="2">Remove the drive belt.</step>
  </procedure>
  <specifications>
    <spec name="Mounting Bolt Torque" value="18" unit="Nm"/>
  </specifications>
</article>

get.description: Returns maintenance schedules organized by frequency (e.g., every 5,000 miles)
Returns maintenance schedules organized by interval type
Returns maintenance schedules by dashboard indicators (warning lights)

Returns a diagram or image. Supports resizing via query parameters.
Common formats: JPEG for photos, PNG for diagrams, SVG for vector graphics.

200.description:
Image data. Content-Type header indicates format:
- `image/jpeg` - JPEG image
- `image/png` - PNG image  
- `image/svg+xml` - SVG vector graphic

Returns content changes for a vehicle in a specific quarter

added.title: WATER FOUND IN TRUNK AFTER HEAVY RAIN

contentSource.name: contentSource
contentSource.description:
Content source identifier. Common values:
- `MOTOR` - MOTOR database (most common)
- `Honda`, `Ford`, `Toyota`, etc. - OEM-specific

vehicleId.name: vehicleId
vehicleId.description:
Vehicle identifier. Format: `{id}:{engineId}` or just `{id}`.
Swagger UI will automatically URL-encode the colon.

vehicleIdPath.name: vehicleId
vehicleIdPath.description:
Vehicle identifier. Format: `{id}:{engineId}` or just `{id}`.
Swagger UI will automatically URL-encode the colon.

vehicleId.description: Vehicle identifier for use in other API calls

Article.description:
Article object. Fields vary by bucket type:
- DTCs have `code`, `description`
- TSBs have `bulletinNumber`, `releaseDate`
- Diagrams have `thumbnailHref`
- Procedures have `parentBucket`

title.description: Article title (may be empty for DTCs)
